intro: Waltheria douradinha, commonly known as the Brazilian nightshade, is a herbaceous plant native to South America. It belongs to the Solanaceae family, which includes tomatoes, potatoes, and peppers. The plant features hairy, branched stems and lobed leaves with a slightly rough texture. Its flowers are typically white or pale purple, with five petals, and it produces small, fleshy berries that contain toxic seeds. Due to its toxic properties, it is not recommended for cultivation or consumption.
